str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
A snare, stumbling-block, cause for error. Scandal; probably from a derivative of kampto; a trap-stick, i.e. Snare.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Folly, absurdity, foolishness. From moros; silliness, i.e. Absurdity.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
